org.coniks.coniks_server

Class UserTreeBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.coniks.coniks_server.UserTreeBuilder

  • public class UserTreeBuilder
extends java.lang.Object
    Implements all operations necessary for building a CONIKS Merkle prefix tree on the server. Current hashing algorithm used: SHA-256.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void clearTemps()
      Clears some temporary variables set during a previous call to UserTreeBuilder#createNewTree(PriorityQueue>, byte[], long).
      RootNode copyExtendTree(RootNode prevRoot, byte[] prevRootHash, java.util.PriorityQueue<> pendingQ, long epoch)
      Clones the previous epoch's tree prevRoot and extends it with any new nodes in pendingQ to add for the next epoch epoch.
      RootNode createNewTree(java.util.PriorityQueue<> pendingQ, byte[] prevRootHash, long epoch)
      Creates a completely new Merkle tree with any nodes in pendingQ, and with the previous epoch's root hash prevRootHash for the new epoch epoch.
      RootNode extendTree(java.util.PriorityQueue<> pendingQ)
      Inserts any new nodes in pendingQ ordered by the 24-bit prefix of their lookup index into the Merkle tree, and recomputes all necessary hashes.
      static UserTreeBuilder getInstance()
      Generates a single instance of the user tree builder.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • clearTemps

        public void clearTemps()
        Clears some temporary variables set during a previous call to UserTreeBuilder#createNewTree(PriorityQueue>, byte[], long).

      • getInstance

        public static UserTreeBuilder getInstance()
        Generates a single instance of the user tree builder.
        Returns:
        A new user tree builder.

      • copyExtendTree

        public RootNode copyExtendTree(RootNode prevRoot,
                      byte[] prevRootHash,
                      java.util.PriorityQueue<> pendingQ,
                      long epoch)
        Clones the previous epoch's tree prevRoot and extends it with any new nodes in pendingQ to add for the next epoch epoch.

        This is a useful wrapper for UserTreeBuilder#extendTree(PriorityQueue>).

        Returns:
        The RootNode for the next epoch's Merkle tree.

      • extendTree

        public RootNode extendTree(java.util.PriorityQueue<> pendingQ)
        Inserts any new nodes in pendingQ ordered by the 24-bit prefix of their lookup index into the Merkle tree, and recomputes all necessary hashes.
        Returns:
        The RootNode of the extended Merkle tree.

      • createNewTree

        public RootNode createNewTree(java.util.PriorityQueue<> pendingQ,
                     byte[] prevRootHash,
                     long epoch)
        Creates a completely new Merkle tree with any nodes in pendingQ, and with the previous epoch's root hash prevRootHash for the new epoch epoch.
        Returns:
        The RootNode of the new Merkle tree.
